revised_title: Hemisection of the Spinal Cord in Monkeys: Sensory Impulses and Motor Responses
tldr: The author investigates the effects of hemisection of the spinal cord in monkeys and discovers that sensory disturbances do not correspond to previous observations. The study reveals that certain sensory impulses pass mainly up the same side, while painful impressions travel up both sides. The findings also show vaso-motor disturbances, degenerations, and the origin and course of long and short tract fibers.
